body: I'll do a pass.
Looks good. Can we test this on HDI to be safe? I'll test locally on Windows.
I can test it on HDI
Thanks! I am running Java and .NET tests on Windows. Once those and the ones on HDI pass, I can merge this.

I've had no luck building it so far, but I start to suspect that there is some problem with my installation of VS 2015; at least that's what `Failed to locate: "CL.exe"` hints at. I'll see if I can get rid of this error.
Tests pass for Java and .NET when run locally.
Both Java 29 tests and HelloREEF passed in HDI cluster.
@jwang98052 Thanks, I will merge
Does this mean the findbugs reports are not in the `target` folder? Can we configure it such that they are?

No, reports are in `target/findbugs` folder of each project, because they are per-project; the hack is about all projects using the same configuration.

This pull request looks good
@jwang98052 No the commit mentions issue #506 instead of #502. Hence, that PR was closed. I'll close this one.
@zerg-zerg I did a pass and left one comment. Also, can you suppress the warning in `NameClient`?
I'll do a pass.
@jwang98052 Looks good. Did you test it on HDI?

@markusweimer Left a few more minor comments. I think it may be worthwhile to investigate whether the `Clr2Java` objects can change in the unmanaged layer of the code such that we don't need to instantiate a new object on every `get` call, but this might be another item and may require a look from @beysims or @yingdachen.

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #550](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/550/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good
I'm busy all day. +1 on someone else merging after we confirmed it runs on HDI.
Thanks for catching it! I just checked, looks like we haven't use #506 yet. Just want to make sure I didn't accidentally close another.
@markusweimer I'll take a pass and test on HDI.
@markusweimer @jwang98052 Ping...
@anupam128 I'm done with my second pass. Mostly minor comments. Thanks!

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #551](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/551/) UNSTABLE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

@afchung Thanks. I filled [REEF-772](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-772) to track down the `Clr2Java` properties. We won't close on this without input from @beysims or @yingdachen. Hence, I suggest we move forward with this PR as a net-positive and clean those up later.

I'll act on your other feedback later today.

I've done a pass. Two overarching comments:
- `SubmitAsync` on a method that isn't `async` is odd. Also, it grabs the name such that we can't use it in future APIs. Maybe use `SubmitAndGetDriverUrl`?
- I don't think we should change any of the examples or applications in the code base to use this API. It is temporary anyhow.
@markusweimer sounds good.
@anupam128 How will we version this when Hadoop changes its REST schemas? Other than that, this looks good to me.

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #552](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/552/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good
@afchung I addressed your feedback, please have another look.
@afchung You know C# and REST and the APIs involved better than me. Assume a +0 from me and merge when you think it is ready :-)

In the new Submit method in LocalClient, we do Launch Java with a separate  Task.Run(() =>. And then pull the result back. I have renamed it anyway as it is temporary. 
I have changed most places to use old Submit. Keep one test case to call the new  SubmitAndGetDriverUrl because I would like to have a test case for it.
The change has pushed in.
Looks good, will test and merge.

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #553](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/553/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good
I've done a pass

@afchung I started out with the intention to try and solve API versioning problem but that makes this change too big/solving too many problems. As the API is currently internal only and is intended to stay that way and wrapped with public facing REEF Client API I think instead of over-engineering this right now we can tackle the versioning issue when required.

@tcNickolas This looks great. One suggestion I have is to change `CharSet.forName("UTF-8")` in `getBytes` and `"UTF-8"` in `StreamReader` to `StandardCharsets.UTF_8`.
@tcNickolas @markusweimer Let me know when you think the change is stable. I can also double check this change at my local machine.
@dongjoon-hyun Thanks for the fixes. This looks good. I will merge.
@bgchun Thank you.
